name: Sociology of the Family
title: WCAS SOCIOL 310-0-20 Sociology of the Family

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: What issues are facing families today and how are families changing? This course will examine the evolution of family structure and relationships over the past couple of decades as well as looking at contemporary issues and debates in family life including same-sex marriage and single motherhood.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: During preregistration this course is only open to Sociology Majors & Minors. This course is open to all students during regular registration starting November 16, 2015.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
- Understand contemporary issues in family life including changes in family structure over the past few decades and changes in marital and parenting patterns and choices.
- Examine contemporary debates surrounding family life including same-sex marriage and single motherhood.
- Understand how family members balance work and home commitments and the role of the family in the economy.
- Explore how sociologists have researched family life and family relationships.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture, Class Participation, Group Work, Written Assignments

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Required:
Edin & Kefalas, Promises I Can Keep: Why Poor Women Put Motherhood before Marriage (978-0520271463)
Sandberg, Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead (978-0385349949)
